DOC.brief_summary: Musculoskeletal pain highly prevalent , disabling , high socio-economic cost , many negative effect quality life . It affect ability perform work , social , recreational domestic task , change mood concentration population . Despite worldwide prevalence socioeconomic burden condition , clear understand etiology pathogenesis remain elusive . Aims : ( ) analyze possible level association fear pain , fear movement , self-efficacy , pain acceptance pain-disability start study prospectively evaluate role risk factor ; ( ii ) evaluate possible role prognostic factor fear pain , fear movement , self-efficacy pain acceptance develop musculoskeletal pain follow-up ; ( iii ) explore possible mediate power fear movement self-efficacy relationship pain-disability ; ( iv ) investigate percentage variance account beliefs ( fear pain , fear movement , self-efficacy , acceptance pain ) predicting onset / maintenance musculoskeletal pain .
DOC.detailed_description: The present study prospective observational study 4 year carry September 2017 September 2020 University Malaga . Several questionnaire assess different belief associate pain administer participant . The result evaluate baseline ( t1 ) 4 follow-ups ( 12 ( t2 ) , 24 ( t3 ) , 36 ( t4 ) 48 ( t5 ) month . It implement reported line SPIRIT statement STROBE guidance . Participants A consecutive sample healthy male female student , student University Málaga , recruit . Research assistant train principal investigator charge carry recruitment evaluate participant eligibility . Participants meet inclusion criterion invite participate study , evaluate baseline 12 , 24 , 36 48 month follow-up . The inclusion criterion follow : ( ) men / woman 18 year ; ( ii ) student University Málaga belong one discipline previously mention . The exclusion criterion follow : ( ) participant currently experience musculoskeletal pain ; ( ii ) participant currently take medication ; ( iii ) previous history musculoskeletal surgery ; ( Iv ) inability provide write informed consent / complete questionnaire .
